intro: Selinum intermedium, commonly known as the common fennel, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic herbs like parsley and carrots. The plant has finely divided, feathery leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers in umbels. It is often cultivated for its licorice-like aroma and edible foliage. Selinum intermedium is also valued for its medicinal properties and use in traditional herbal remedies.
